Upon closer inspection of the dresses, she smiled and said, "Caeda, I think I've found them."

As Caeda came up to see, she saw the clothes that Oboro had found. Sure enough the dresses, which came in white, blue, cyan, and magenta and looked subtle yet beautiful, were certainly meant for some large women in more ways than one. "I thought as much... now all I need to do is adjust the fabric of these dresses to fit your proportions better. With the notes that I've taken, it shouldn't take me too long to get the first one properly tailored for you." Caeda nodded at this as Oboro covered her with a blanket to preserve her modesty and said, "I'll be right back." The Hoshidan seamstress soon took the fancy white dress to the other room to make her modifications.

~28 Minutes Later~

"I'm all done with the first dress." Oboro called out to Caeda as she came out with the readjusted dress, "Here's your first temporary dress. Try it on and see if it fits." Caeda took the dress with care and then went and put it on. While a little difficult at first to get on, once she did, she was amazed by how well the white dress to fit her generous curves snugly. Oboro then stated as Caeda was looking over herself, "I had to make adjustments so that it could fit around your trim waist and still fit around your generous breasts and hips." It was quite evident of the effort that the seamstress had undergone to get the dress to work. Having just over a fifty inch difference between her underbust and full breast size showed just how big Caeda's breasts were. They would've hung down close to her navel if not for the fact that their sheer perkiness allowed them to stick out almost several good inches away from herself. Caeda adjusted the top part of her dress and noted that felt both loose and yet snug around her breasts.

Caeda gave Oboro a look that held a question and the seamstress then stated, "I had to adjust the dress so that in case you grew again, the dress could compensate for your growth in case you grow an extra several centimeters or so. I did the same thing to a lesser extent for the bottom part of your dress in case your hips grow out any more as well." Caeda brought her hand to her mouth in awe as she said, "That's amazing Oboro." She then brought her hands to her breasts which were practically the size of fully ripened melons and carefully felt the soft fabric that held them in place. For reasons she couldn't think of, she was beginning to adore their new size. A thought came to Caeda as she then asked, "Will the owners be alright with me taking dresses like this? Won't I have to pay for them?"

Oboro gave a light smile as she said, "Most likely, but I have a feeling that they'll be lenient with the prices given the urgency of your situation. They happen to be very understandable of stuff like this. Plus, they've been helping out the Order of Heroes in recent months and since I've been helping out as thanks, they tend to give us a discount." This had Caeda feel at ease from this fact. "Anyway, I'll get the other three dresses made for you shortly, and then I'll make sure your wedding dress is perfect. Though if you happen to grow any more, don't be afraid to come back and let me know immediately. In case you do grow out more, I'll make the necessary adjustments." Caeda nodded at this as the two soon went back to the front of the store where Marth and Takumi were waiting.

Upon seeing Caeda, Marth and Takumi were thrown for a loop seeing Caeda's new size, as well as how well the dress that Oboro picked out and made looked on her. When asked about her new growth spurt, Oboro admitted that she did her usual thing and forgot about the stipulation that would cause Caeda to grow. Being the kind and understanding person that he was, Marth figured it was an accident and told Oboro not to worry so much about it. However, he couldn't help but compliment Caeda for looking so stunning in her dress. Thankfully, Caeda figured out how to control herself a little giving a light smile as she thanked Marth. It seemed that it was enough to not trigger another growth spurt for the time being.

155323333333312.content:
Loki chuckled as she walked through the bloody battlefield. The Order of Heroes and Hel's army had fought a long, grueling and bloody fight here not even an hour ago, and now, there were nothing but bodies of the fallen soldiers of the Order of Heroes' and Hel's armies. Loki had an evil smile on her face as she looked at the lifeless corpses on the ground, where a mix of both Heroes and Soldiers lay. She had an idea for these new...creations. Røkkr's. Giant, evil versions of the Order's precious Heroes that she'd send off to fight. They'd be utterly gigantic, and nearly impossible to take down. She'd use the fallen spirits that carried a grudge in life to create these Røkkr's, These confused, frustrated and lost souls would be the perfect base for her new creations. With her staff, and a ritual she devised herself, she absorbed several souls and mashed them together into one hostile soul. It glowed blood red in Loki's staff, and she chuckled to herself.

"Hehehe....this will surely be exciting to watch~ I can't wait until the summoner and his little army tries to fight this~" Loki said, examining the Røkkr soul she had created. Suddenly, the soul began to shake her staff quite radically.

"Hmm? What's happening?" Loki asked, concerned. This was a new thing she had done, so she wasn't the most experienced at creating Røkkr's. At least not yet. She extended her staff outwards and fired the soul outwards into the ground several feet away. The soul floated upwards slightly and began shaking wildly. Loki raised an eyebrow in curiosity and confusion. Red mist began to surround the soul, and not long after, it dissipated. However, the soul was gone. What was there instead was...a person's body? The soul had taken physical form, and it became a woman with long blue hair and a white flower patterned outfit. She was standing motionless with her eyes shut.

"Oooooh? So that's what it was doing~" Loki said with a smirk. "Hmm....I think I've seen this person before...Azura I think her name was?" Loki said to herself. Immediately after Loki said her name, the Røkkr opened her eyes.

"......" Azura stayed silent.

"Excellent~" Loki said to herself. She began to walk forward towards Azura, and she grimaced creating a Sapphire Lance out of the same red mist that made her body.

"S̴̙͗ṫ̶̨à̷̢y̶͎͂.̴̫̉.̵̙̓.̶̗͂ḅ̵͌ą̶͠c̴̯̈́k ̵̖̐.̶͓̐.̵̩̀.̸͙̕" Azura said. Loki chuckled.

"No need to be so defensive. I'm not going to hurt you. In fact...I helped bring you back to life~" Loki said with a smirk.

"W̶̖̍h̸̖̄ȃ̶̬t̶̞̆.̶͚̾.̴̻͛.̷̤͝?̶̲͠ ̶̜͊N̵̦̈ņ̶̐n̵̯̕g̴͈̓h̵̯̾.̸͇͆.̴̺͌.̶̥̾!̵̘͗" Azura said, clutching her head. Her head was throbbing, as if she was trying to remember something. The multitude of souls inside of her own remembered their own deaths, and how the Order of Heroes were forced to retreat during the battle.

"T̶̞̔h̵̝̉e̸͍̐ẏ̶̬.̵̹̇.̷͓̒.̴̰̒ḷ̴̈e̶̘͝f̷͉̍t ̴͈̆.̵̮̑.̵͖͋.̵̣͛m̸̍ͅe̸̬͋.̵̥̉.̵̩͆.̴̛̭" Azura said with a look of utter rage on her face. Loki chuckled evilly and approached Azura once more.

"Yes they did. They left you to die. To rot away alongside everyone else." She said, extending her arm to show Azura the wasteland of corpses. "But I brought you back. I was able to help you cheat death." Loki said with a devious smile.

"......." Azura stayed silent, looking at the corpses scattered along the battlefield. Loki decided to use this opportunity to get inside her head.

"Now that you've seen what they've done to you...don't you want revenge? To take your anger out on those that abandoned you?" Loki said deviously, placing a hand on Azura's shoulder as she looked out onto the wasteland once more.

"T̶̞̔h̵̝̉e̸͍̐ẏ̶̬.̵̹̇.̷͓̒.̴̰̒ḷ̴̈e̶̘͝f̷͉̍t ̴͈̆.̵̮̑.̵͖͋.̵̣͛m̸̍ͅe̸̬͋.̵̥̉.̵̩͆.̴̛̭" She said once more. "Ȉ̷̡'̶̺̋l̷̹̂l̷̬͋.̶̰̂.̶͖̕.̵̗̀k̶͍̋i̸̥͌l̶̮̊l ̵̥̏.̷͍̎.̷̳͐.̴̑͜t̶͇́h̶͙͑ẹ̸̚m̵̬̊.̴̻̀.̵̛̺.̵́ͅ" ; Azura spat. The red mist that created her body began to engulf her. The expression of anger on Azura's face struck fear into even Loki's heart. "I̷̭̓'̶̘̚l̷̬̆l̶͖͠ ̶͍͗k̴̤͊ḯ̴͕l̵̘̽ĺ̷̰ ̵̗̔t̵͙̆h̴͇͆e̸͙̚m̵̩̀ ̴͕͝a̸͗͜l̸̨̈́l̷̰͑!̴̪͋"̷̪́"

With that, Azura's body began to absorb the dark energy that created the mist around her. Suddenly...the Røkkr Azura's body began to grow, and Loki took a step back with a grin on her face. Her visions for the Røkkr's were finally becoming a reality.

"Yes...! Grow my creation! Grow! Grow so you can get your revenge on those who abandoned you!" Loki said, chuckling evilly. "This may be my best idea yet!" There was no WAY they'd be able to fight this! Azura passed 15 feet in height...then 20...then 25....

"Don't worry my creation~ You'll have your revenge soon enough. In fact...you can enact it now if you'd like~" She spoke with a grin on her face.

"No fair! You're cheating!" Mia said with an upset expression on her face.

"Whaaaat? C'mon, would a guy like me cheat at something like this?" Joshua said while flipping a coin with his thumb.

"It's either dumb luck or cheating kid, and you seem to have a lot of luck." Saber said, keeping his good eye on him.

"Guilty as charged." Joshua shrugged with a smirk. "Hey old timer, what's the sights like out there?" Joshua called out towards the window. The veteran knight known as Jagen walked in.

"I kindly ask you to refrain from calling me an 'old timer'. And to answer your question, nothing of interest to report so far." Jagen responded.

"C'mon, why don't you take a break and we'll play cards? Maybe we'll have a little wager." Joshua said with a grin. Jagen smirked.

"I know your type. I'll have you know I know my way around your little card game." Jagen responded.

"Oh yeah? Prove it old timer." Joshua said, locking eyes with the Altean knight.

"Very well. Mia, I believe it's your turn on lookout duty." Jagen said, sitting down while not breaking the intense staredown with Joshua.

"Alright! I'll go right now!" Mia said, excited as ever. Even something as simple as lookout duty she does with a smile on her face. She leaves the room to the lookout post.

"Watch and learn old timer." Joshua said. Saber dealt the cards and they began their game. However, before they could finish the first hand, the room shook softly.

"Err.." Saber said, looking around. "You guys felt that right?" He asked.

"Yeah...this better not be one of your tricks." Jagen said, looking at Joshua.

"For once, it's not." Joshua responded. They heard a loud scream.

"OH GODS!" The voice said.

"Mia...? What's happening?!" Jagen asked, getting up. Mia ran back into the room with a terrified expression on her face, and all of the color and excitement from her demeanor was replaced with terror.

"We've got a BIG problem...!" Mia said, panting heavily.

"What? Are we being attacked by Hel's forces?!" Jagen asked. Mia couldn't even respond, and shook her head. She pointed outside, and the three men walked outside, only to have a chill flow down their spine.

"A-Azura...?!" Saber said. True to word, the 30 foot Azura was on her way to the castle, and could be seen rapidly approaching. If her expression was anything to go by, she wasn't going to be friendly.

"How did she get so...big?!" Joshua asked in shock.

"Not sure, but we have to sound the alarm! Inform Prince Alfonse and Commander Anna immediately!" Jagen said, his experience allowing him to act in a time of crisis.

------------

Azura had the castle in her sights. The travel to the castle wasn't long, especially at her size, and her anger hadn't dissipated at all since her growth. Once she finally saw the castle, she sped up in order to get her revenge sooner.

"T̵̤̈ḫ̸̏é̵͓r̶̗͒e̶̠͊ ̸t̶̤̍h̵͖͝e̷͈̒ẏ̸̫ ̴͉̓a̸͝r̸e̴̫̎.̸̩͆.̷͍̿.̸̬̈́" She said to herself. With each step she took towards the castle, the tremors felt by the Order of Heroes grew stronger. She toppled over trees and destroyed the forest to make a path for herself, and didn't care in the slightest the destruction she was causing. Loki watched from a safe distance, not wanting to get too close so she isn't noticed by the Order of Heroes, and isn't caught in the middle of Azura's rampage. She rubbed her hands together in anticipation with a wicked grin on her face.

"Time for the show to begin~" She said evilly.

Once Azura reached one of the castle walls, she used her strength to completely topple the wall, and walked into one of the castle courtyards. People began screaming at this point, and Heroes and servants alike scattered. The angry look on Azura's face grew more intense, as the various souls within her became more restless seeing their old "comrades" again. Azura lifted her foot and slammed it down, crushing two servants under it into a bloody mess."

"Ḭ̴̆'̸͕̈́ḹ̵l̵̢̓ ̶̼͒k̷̟̃i̷͎̐ḽ̶̈́l̶̙͌ ̸͙̂y̶͎͒ò̶̜u̸̞̍.̴͍͘.̶͚͒.̵͓͛Î̴̟'̷̟͂L̵͕̓L̴͓̃ ̷̠͠K̸͙̾I̴͈͆L̴͇̚L̷̪̋ ̵̩͌Y̶̤͌Ỏ̸̠U̶͉͌ ̸̭͑A̸͕͠L̵̻̓L̸̦͊!̷͔̌" Azura yelled. She used her strength to topple another internal wall, and began to walk deeper into the castle.

------------

The Prince of Askr and the Legendary Summoner Kiran looked at Azura from across the castle with worried looks on their faces.

"What happened to Azura...?" Kiran said with a dropped jaw. They watched as several Heroes tried to fire arrows and magic at the Røkkr, but their arrows simply bounced off of her or she absorbed their magical blasts.

"That's not me." A voice said from behind. The two's eyes widened and looked behind them.

"Azura?!" They both said. She nodded, and Anna walked out from behind her.

"It's not her. I don't know what that thing is, but it's destroying the castle! We need to take her down!" Anna said.

"But how?" Kiran asked, looking back at the carnage across from them. "The Heroes' weapons aren't affecting her!" Anna grimaced, knowing this was the case.

"We have to use our Magic Orbs! If we can concentrate all of our turrets on the giant Azura, we may be able to stop her!" Alfonse said. Anna nodded.

"I'll get on that." Anna said, rushing down the hall. Azura looked in terror at the destruction that "she" was causing. The expression on her evil self's face was one she didn't even know she was capable of making.

---------

"Attention all Heroes! We need all hands on the castles Magic Orbs immediately! This is not a drill! Everybody concentrate fire on the giant Azura!" Anna said through her voice-amplification device. The Røkkr Azura heard Anna and turned around, eagle-eyeing Anna from across the castle, and decided to make her way towards her.

"C̵̜̚ȏ̵̱m̵̳͐m̶̦͘a̴̠̾ṇ̷̄d̵̢̍ē̵̡ř̵̲ ̶͎̽Ä̷̹ṇ̷͋ǹ̷͜a̴̝̒.̶̜̀.̷̣̔.̸̧̊" Azura said, striking fear into Anna's heart. Anna backed up in fear of the approaching Azura, and yelled another order through her voice amplification device.

"Heroes..! Where are those Magic Orbs...?!" She said, panicking. Sure enough, Linde, Leo, Mae and Tharja were seen manning four Magic Orb turrets aimed at Azura.

"Ready!? FIRE!" Leo yelled, and the four mages fired a hefty blast of magic simultaneously towards Azura. Azura turned around and saw the four blasts coming straight for her. There was no way she could get out of the way in time, and the blasts strike her.

Through some events, that she didn't understand herself, this young woman became the new Professor for the Black Eagles House gere at the monestary. Edelgard developed a kind of 'obsession' with her new professor. Before, she didn't even know she could feel like this for anyone, let alone for a woman, but now she knew. She wanted to spend the rest of her life with her. But she was a teacher. How would she get Byleth to notice her feelings?She spend so much time with the other girls in the monestary too. In her quest to win over her teachers heart, the leader of the Black Eagles stumbled upon something. Hilda hears a knock at her door...
1553313111.content:
Garreg Mach Monastery, home of the Fodlan-renowned Officers Academy.

Located slap-bang in the centre of Fodlan, it received visitors from all parts of Fodlan. The Adrestian Empire, the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus and the Leicester Alliance all relied on the monastery for trade and, rarely, a place where they could sort out any matters between them.

Yet the potential for war was the furthest thing from Hilda's mind as she strolled through the market, prized pink pigtails bouncing and swaying in the wind as she did so. Humming a pleasant tune to herself, her eyes darted from stall to stall, searching for... something. What it was, she didn't quite know yet. All she knew was her brother had sent her a bit of money for her birthday and she planned to spend it on her own hobbies, rather than hand it over to her Professor and have it spent on a new axe or something violent like that.

"But what to buy?" Hilda mused as she reached the end of the first street. "So many accessories and components to choose from... Picking just one is going to be impossible!"

With the locations of a few stalls with intriguing bits and pieces remembered, Hilda started down the adjacent street, eyes continuing to dart from left to right as she eagerly searched for something inspiring. With all the training she was being forced to do recently, her hobby of crafting accessories had ground to a halt, much to her annoyance. But with the Garreg Mach Ball coming up in a couple of months, she desperately needed something new, be it bought or crafted by herself.

"Hold there, young lady!"

Hearing a man's booming voice cut across the din of the market, Hilda came to a stop and looked towards the source. Finding herself looking at a man standing next to a cart with the Adrestian Flag flying from it, she narrowed her eyes.

"Can I help you, sir?" Hilda asked, folding her arms over her chest.

"Mayhaps, young one, mayhaps..." The man responded, stepping closer to her. "You look like you're looking for something very particular. And without knowing what it is, I guarantee you I've got it! So why not have a look?"

Slightly creeper out by his method of attracting her attention, Hilda was tempted to ignore him and move on. But then, she shrugged. What harm would there be in taking a look? Worst case, he had nothing for her. But best case, she found the cutest accessory known to mankind. Stepping around to the back of his cart, she peered into it, trying her best to ignore the salesman hovering over her shoulder.

"Wow, so messy!" Hilda exclaimed, finding herself looking into a pile of stuff carelessly chucked into a cart. "But, hold on..."

Reaching into the pile of junk, taking care to avoid the weapons that were scattered throughout, she grabbed a leather bound book and pulled it free, almost causing an avalanche of various ores and other books. Leaving the cart owner to deal with it, she inspected the book.

"A DIY Accessory Book..." She mumbled, flicking to a random page. As she did, her pink eyes lit up excitedly. "Oh my Goddess! That's super pretty! And this one as well!"

Eagerly turning to the owner, who had managed to right his mountain of junk, Hilda held the book up.

"How much?" She asked.

"Hmm... For you, my dear, a mere three hundred gold," He replied.

Without a second thought about it, Hilda dropped the gold into his hand and, goal achieved, rushed back to the Monastery...

=====


"Alright! Let's have a proper look!"

Dropping the book on her desk, Hilda eagerly began to flick through it, looking at a few accessories that caught her eyes. Eventually, she reached a golden brooch with a vibrant pink stone, not unlike her eye colour, set into it.

"Oh, super cute..." She said to herself, scanning the instructions. "And I've got everything to make it right now! Wait... Requires a magical touch? What the heck does that even mean?"

Thinking about it for a moment, she shrugged.

"Whatever!" She exclaimed, grabbing her box of components. "I'll just have Lysithea do her thing on it! Now, begin with the golden inset..."

=====


Hilda quickly lost track of time as she went about her work. But eventually, she was done. Well, almost. Lifting her creation into the light, she ran a critical eye over it, looking for any mistakes she might have made. Spotting none, she nodded and, brooch in hand, headed for her door. If she knew Lysithea, and she liked to think she did, she'd be in the library, studying Crests again. For some weird reason, the white-haired girl adored studying them, yet never explained why.

Making her to the library, Hilda arrived a little later than she had expected. Initially, she was avoiding the Professor, who was out on one of their hunts to have students eat with them, but then she almost ran into Seteth, who was just as eager to discuss her work, or lack of, with her. Thankfully, she managed to avoid both and made it to the library, just in time to catch Lysithea leaving.

"Lysithea!" Hilda called out happily, earning her an irate 'Shush!' from a nearby monk. "Sorry..."

"Hilda," Lysithea replied curtly. "Can I help you with something?"

"Sure can!" Hilda responded, showing her the brooch. "I need you to cast a bit of magic on this for me!"

Lysithea eyed the ornament before looking up at Hilda with confusion.

"You want me... to enchant a bit of jewellery?"

Hilda nodded happily.

"Um... Why?"

"Because the instructions said so, silly!" Hilda laughed. "Now, come on! Do your thing! Cast that magic!"

Lysithea let out a sigh before holding out a petite hand. Gently setting the brooch in her palm, Hilda stepped back and let the unusually powerful girl imbue it with magic, which took but a second with Lysithea. As she took the brooch back, she noted the gem now had a bright glow to it, which caused the gold to glimmer beautifully.

"Thanks, Lysithea!" Hilda said cheerfully, turning her back on the small girl. "If you ever need me for anything, I'm your girl!"

"Yeah, right..." She heard Lysithea mumble as she made her way back towards her room.

=====


After avoiding the Professor, who was now looking for axe wielders for the Inter-House Tournament, Seteth and Claude, who seemed eager to discuss something with her, Hilda ended up back in her room, standing in front of her mirror. Holding her brooch up, she held in front of her outfit, trying to determine the best place she could put it. Eventually, she settled on a spot just over her left breast, which was a bit of a struggle considering the size of her bust and the tightness of her dress. But once it was attached, she smiled at her reflection.

"Looks perfect!" She enthused, straightening her new decoration...
1553313111.title: Hilda's DIY Accessory

choices: Upon arriving, Hilda finds it empty...

15533131112.content:
Pleased with her new accessory, Hilda spun on her heel to face her door. So far today, she had been avoiding almost everybody, unless they could help her with construction. But now, despite the somewhat later hour it was, she wanted to get out there and show off her new accessory. She wanted the Professor to notice it, to comment on it and say 'Good job!'. She wanted Seteth to see it and realise that maybe she did do work after all, as long as it benefited her somehow. And who knows, maybe somebody would ask her to make something for them?

"Oh, I bet Marianne would look awesome with a golden hairclip!" Hilda enthused, starting towards her door. "Or maybe something for Lysithea? I do need to thank her for her magic touch... And Leonie! I could make something to replace that rather ugly necklace Captain Jeralt made her!"

As Hilda left her room, she stopped talking aloud about all the ideas she had, but continued to imagine them. Perhaps a golden ring with a deer etched onto it for Claude, a decorative button for Raphael that would be both nice to look at and functional. Lorenz would get something to replace that hideous flower he had attached to his uniform and Ignatz... She didn't quite know yet. But she was sure she'd find something for him in her new book!

Leaving the second floor, still deep in thought, she was passing the greenhouse when she heard a few voices from within. Peeking through th door, Hilda spotted Professor Manuela and Dorothea talking, though about what, she couldn't figure out.

What a great opportunity! Hilda thought excitedly. Both of them were part of that Adrestian Opera Company, meaning they're bound to know all about super pretty accessories! Lets see what they think of mine...

"Professor Manuela! Dorothea!"

Practically skipping into the greenhouse, Hilda smiled at them in turn. Their conversation came to a halt as both turned to look at Hilda.

"Hilda," Dorothea greeted her warily, which she expected, seeing as Dorothea was from the Black Eagle house. While inter-house relations were encouraged by the faculty, very few students actually partook in it.

"Miss Valentine, is there an issue?" Manuela asked, not quite so cautious of the pink haired girl. Being a Professor, she had to be ready to assist any students, not just those of her own house. But even so, Manuela tended to favour the Black Eagles, which was her house, over others. The only one that didn't show favouritism was Professor Hanneman, leader of the Blue Lions.

"Nope, no issue!" Hilda giggled excitedly. "But I'd like to ask the two of you a question... What do think of this?"

Framing her brooch with both hands, she watched eagerly as both woman turned their eyes to it. For a worrying moment, they showed no reaction to it but, thankfully, Dorothea stepped forwards for a closer look.

"It's beautiful..." She murmured, lightly poking the glowing gem. "Where in Garreg Mach did you get it?"

"I made it!" Hilda replied proudly. "So, it's kinda one-of-a-kind at the minute! But, if you really want one, I guess I could make another..."

Dorothea let out an excited 'Oh!', while behind her, Manuela nodded slowly.

"Truly great design and construction, Miss Valentine," She said, joining Dorothea for a closer look. "While yours is unique in that it glows, I have seen a few like it while I was a performer. They were all mass-constructed, of course, not as striking as yours is. But if you are accepting orders, as it were... Well, I could use a new brooch myself! But another time. Edelgard wished to have a word with me..."

Next to her, Dorothea nodded, sighing as she did.

"I am afraid I must leave as well," She said heavily. "Ferdinand wanted to speak to me about something. No doubt he's still trying to figure out my riddle!"

And with that, both woman left the greenhouse, leaving Hilda alone with the Gardener. Glancing down at her brooch, she grinned and readjusted it. As she did so, however, she noted that it was a bit more difficult to do. Her dress seemed a tad tighter around her bust, making adjusting it a little harder. But she eventually got it and, pleased with her appearance, started for her next location; the Dining Hall...
15533131112.title: Rest and Relaxation for the barely-working Hilda

155331311123.content:
Drawing level with the Fishing Pond, Hilda happened to glance over at the shimmering waters. A single figure, clad almost entirely on black, stood on the wooden bridge extending out over the waters, a fishing for clutched in their hands. As she watched, they sharply pulled back on the rod, a fish breaking through the surface of the water until it came to rest just in front of their face. Shrugging, the figure tossed the fish back into the waters.

"Oh, no..." Hilda muttered to herself, watching as the figure began to turn. As they did, she broke into a run, eager to get away from the figure before -

"Hilda".

Hearing her name called, Hilda froze. Taking a deep breath, she forced a smile into her face and spun to face the speaker...
155331311123.title: Caught at last

choices: Hilda gets something to eat...

1553313111232.content:
A woman, with dark green hair and blue eyes, stared curiously at Hilda. After a moment of awkward silence, during which both women just stared at each other, Hilda finally spoke up.

"H-Hi, Professor!" She greeted, trying to sound as though she hadn't spent her entire day slacking off. "I was just on my way to the Dining Hall! I'm super famished after all the work I did today! So if you'll just excuse me..."

Going to turn around, Hilda froze when she saw her Professor's eyes narrow suspiciously. Being a woman of very few words, expressions were key with the Professor. And the one she was wearing was rare, except with Hilda. It conveyed clear suspicion, and was one Hilda saw almost anytime she had a conversation with the Professor. Turning back to the Professor, Hilda cleared her throat.

"Well, you see, I was in town for a few hours, looking for some... study materials," Hilda lied, slinging her arms behind her back and adopting the most innocent look she could muster. "I managed to find them, came back to my room and spent the day going through them! I'm just taking a break for dinner, then I'll be heading back".

She received another suspicious glare. After a moment, the Professor's eyes flicked down to the brooch adorning her outfit, at which point the Professor folded her arms across her ample chest. Recognizing this as the advanced stage of suspicion, Hilda's mind raced to come up with something.

"O-Oh, this old thing?" Hilda asked, thumbing the brooch anxiously. "This was... a gift from my brother! Yeah! The gem is from Almyra, you see, and he knows I like jewellery. So he had this made with it! Um... Do you like it?"

The Professor cast a suspicious glance at her face before taking a second look at her brooch. Reaching out a slender finger, she lightly tapped the gem before glancing at her face and nodding. Hilda exhaled slightly, relaxing her body which she didn't even know had tensed up.

"Thanks, Professor," Hilda said with a grateful smile. "If you want, I can see about making one for you! Err, I mean... Getting one for you!"

Hilda received another suspicious glare before the Professor straightened up and held a hand out. Looking at her palm, Hilda cocked a confused eyebrow. The Professor let out a silent sigh before gesturing at the brooch.

"Oh, you want to see it?" Hilda asked, gently unpinning it from her outfit and dropping it into her hand. "Just be careful with it!"

Nodding, the Professor inspected the brooch closely, poking it lightly before flipping it over and looking at the back. Before handing it back to Hilda, she held it over her own chest, smiled gently and then handed it back. Nodding farewell, her Professor marched off, leaving a relieved Hilda alone.

"Well, that was certainly scary..." Hilda breathed, reattaching her beloved pin to her dress. "For a second, I thought she was going to make me do work or something! Or worse, she didn't like it! Anyway, time for something to eat! Hope they've got fish saute..."

Excited for food, Hilda made her way into the Dining Hall, unaware that the gem was glowing more brightly, radiating a gentle heat that filled her chest...
1553313111232.title: Fishing for Compliments

choices: Leaving the Dining Hall, Hilda returns to her room...
As she tries to leave, Hilda is stopped by the Golden Deer...

15533131112323.content:
Striding into the Dining Hall, the scents of meat and fish immediately collided with Hilda's nose, making her pause and inhale the smell of one of her favourite meals. Eager to taste it and not just inhale its divine aroma, Hilda joined the end of the queue. As soon as she did, and caught sight of who was stood just in front of her, she groaned, which accidentally attracted attention to herself.

"Hey there, Hilda! You're looking cute today!"

Looking up at the ginger-haired womanizer, Hilda briefly considered brushing his attempt at flirting off, but quickly decided against it. Rejecting Sylvain just made him come back with a brand new tactic. The best thing, she had discovered, was to play him at his own game.

"Thanks!" She replied with a bright smile. "You're looking quite handsome yourself!"

Sylvain chuckled, running a hand through his mane of ginger hair.

"You know exactly how to talk to a guy," He responded. "I like it. Almost as much as I like that new brooch you're wearing! You have to tell me where you got it!"

An odd warmth filled her chest, yet Hilda paid it no mind. Assuming it stemmed from pride at having her accessory noticed, she giggled and framed it with her hands.

"This?" She asked. "I made this! Spent a few hours earlier putting it together! Glad you like it so much!"

"Like?" Sylvain said. "I'd go so far as to say I love it! The way it glows in the sunlight, how the gem matches your eyes and hair... It's perfect for you. A lovely bit of jewellery for a lovely woman".

Despite her earlier thoughts of rejection, Hilda couldn't help but blush. As she felt her cheeks flush red, her chest swelled with what she thought was happiness and pride. A few seconds later, however, she realised that it wasn't so. Over the din of the Dining Hall and Sylvain's continuing comments, she heard the creak of leather and the almost inaudible *ping* of a button breaking off. Glancing behind her, she looked for Raphael, who was the usual culprit for broken buttons and stretched leather. Instead, she found herself staring at the back of Dedue's head. That was when she looked down.

Oh my... M-My chest!

Hilda's hand almost flew to her chest, which was visibly swelling before her very eyes, when she realised where she was. Managing to restrain herself, she was about to leave the queue to sprint back to her room when -

"Garreg Mach Meat Pie or Two-Fish Saute?"

Hilda stared at the server behind the counter for a few moments, causing them to repeat the question. When she realised they were asking her what she wanted to eat, she managed to stammer something about a fish, resulting in a plate with a pristine white fish sitting on it shoved into her hands. Taking her meal, Hilda ignored her usual table, which had a few Golden Deer members sat around it, as well as Sylvain's friendly wave to join him at his table and made for an empty one in the corner. Taking a seat, she nervously glanced around before turning her attention to her chest which, thankfully, had stopped its abrupt growth. Lightly cupping each breast, Hilda estimated that, by the tightness of her bra and the tightness of both her cotton underdress and leather overtop, she had gone up by at least a cup size.

But why? She wondered, lifting her fork and digging into her meal. Why did my chest start growing all of a sudden? Magic? Sudden growth spurt? Hmmm... Maybe I should ask Professor Manuela...

"Sitting alone?"

Sylvain dropped into the bench opposite her. Leaning forwards, he flashed Hilda one of his signature sly grins.

"Any table would kill to have a beauty like you sitting at it," He continued. "And yet you sit by yourself. What's up?"

Hilda let out a nervous laugh before shovelling around half her meal into her mouth.

"Bothin!" She replied through a full mouth. "I mem... Nothing! Just wanted some time away from the Golden Deer. Claude's being... Claude and Lorenz is being annoying... You know how it is, right?"

Sylvain nodded, an understanding smile on his face.

"That I do. You know, just the other day, Ingrid was telling me -"

Before Sylvain could launch into his story, Hilda had shovelled the last of her dinner into her mouth and jumped to her feet.

"Hate to leave you, Sylvain, but I just remembered..." Hilda struggled for a moment, trying to come up with a viable excuse. "That the Professor is... checking our rooms soon! If you'll excuse me..."

Turning her back on Sylvain, Hilda rushed towards the exit of the Dining Hall...
15533131112323.title: The Womanizer and the Slack-Off

choices: Spotting her brooch, Hilda takes a closer look...
Hilda decides to check the library...
A knock at Hilda's door startles her...
155331311123232.content:
In her rush to leave, Hilda completely forgot about a certain table that was populated entirely with people she didn't really want to see at the moment, but who hadn't seen her all day. As she drew level with said table, she froze as she heard a voice cut across the room.

"Yo, Hilda! What's the big rush?"

Reluctantly, Hilda turned to the speaker, forcing a nervous smile onto her face. Claude, the leader of the Golden Deer House and the grandson of Duke Riegan, the leader of the entire Leicester Alliance, grinned back at her.

"C-Claude," Hilda stammered, a hand travelling to her brooch and fingering it anxiously. "I was just on the way back to my room..."

"But sure we all agreed we'd take the day to relax and, in the evening, get together as a house and discuss a few things," Claude reminded her, lifting a glass filled with water and taking a sip. "We may be students, but it doesn't mean we can't ignore the Alliance. And as one of the more important nobles, we kinda need you there".

"A-Ah, yeah, I suppose that's true..." Hilda mumbled in response, rubbing the back of her head.

"Great!" Claude said as he got to his feet, the rest of the Golden Deer copying him. "Then let's head to the classroom. Should be empty, unless Teach is putting together their lesson plan for the week".

With no viable excuses coming to mind, and the truth completely unbelievable, Hilda begrudgingly followed Claude and the rest of her classmates out of the Hall and towards the Deer Classroom.

=====


Entering the classroom, the first thing the class spotted was a familiar figure, draped in black, hunched over a desk at the front of the room. As they filtered in, their Professor looked up and locked eyes with Claude, who shot her a friendly wave.

"Hey, Teach!" He called out. "Hope you don't mind us using the classroom for talking about stuff in the Alliance. We'll be quiet, promise".

The Professor nodded and returned to her notes, allowing the Golden Deer to rearrange a few desks to form a sort of round table, around which they arranged themselves in rough order of importance. Claude and Lorenz had a brief argument over who got a single bench to themselves, but after Lysithea threatened to hit them both with a Fireball, they quickly agreed that Claude should get it. Hilda sat on his right, while Lorenz sat next to her. Stuck between two guys wasn't an ideal location for her and her... new chest... but she had to make it work.

"Alright, Deers!" Claude cleared his throat and leaned forwards. "Loads of fun stuff has been happening in the Alliance and, as the future leaders, it would do us good to know a bit about what's going on. So, Lorenz, how's Gloucester Territory?"

Lorenz sniffed dismissively before also leaning forwards. As he began to give his report, which involved something about bandits and the Great Bridge of Myrddin, Hilda zoned out. The Bridge was miles from her own territory, plus she had a slightly more pressing issue to figure out.

They don't just grow bigger over the course of a day! Hilda thought, casting a subtle look downwards. Her bigger bust filled her view, almost entirely obscuring her lap. Leaning back, she was nearly off the bench when her lap finally reappeared. Returning to a position that didn't make her look suspicious, Hilda hummed in thought. Unless I've just been really oblivious lately... Or I've been putting on weight! Have I been eating too much?! Maybe the Professor had a point when she said I should train a bit more...

"...And how about Fodlan's Locket? Hilda?"

Hilda jumped as a hand rested on her shoulder. Looking over at Claude, she blinked, trying to remember what her brother had told her recently. Something about an attack? No, a scouting party...

"Um, yeah!" Hilda said with a smile. "A band of Almyran's attacked recently, but nothing to worry about! My brother chased them off before they came anywhere near the Locket!"

Claude nodded, while Lorenz clapped slowly.

"Well, well!" He commented. "Seems she remembered something about her own territory!"

"Knock it off, Lorenz," Claude told him. "But yeah, good job, Hilda. The Locket's an important part of the Alliance. We're lucky to have Lord Holst looking after it. Now, Raphael and Ignatz! What's the word on trade routes?"

Her time in the spotlight over, Hilda relaxed slightly. However...

"...Where'd you get it?" Hilda heard Raphael ask. "I wanted to get one for my sister. I'm sure she'd love something that pretty!"

As the compliment reached her ears, Hilda felt warmth fill her chest again. Eye wide, she glanced downwards towards her chest. Spotting her chest swelling, she suddenly stood up, startling everyone at the table.

"Hilda?" Claude asked, looking up at her.

"Um... Please excuse me!"

Hilda started for the door. As she reached it, however, she found a woman standing in front of it, eyes narrowed suspiciously. Hilda ignored her Professor's stern gaze, however, and pushed past her. As soon as she was out of sight of the classroom, she broke into a desperate sprint a d headed for her room.

=====


Slamming her door shut behind her, Hilda quickly locked it. Taking a moment to catch her breath after her sudden sprint, she looked down at her chest. However, her outfit did a good job of masking the size of her chest, so she quickly stripped down to her underwear and stood in front of her mirror.

O-M-G! Hilda thought in disbelief, cupping each breast. They're like the size of watermelons! As firm as one as well... But seriously, what's causing this to happen?

"Oh-ho-ho-ho!"

A haughty laugh echoed through the tunnels of Abyss, startling a few of the stray cats wandering the dank tunnels. With a number of irritated hisses, they hurried away from the makeshift classroom, just as an ominous green glow flashed from its doorway. However, the classroom's only occupant, a blonde haired woman clad in a worn dress, wasn't worried in the slightest. Everything was going according to her calculations...

"Finally!" She announced, clapping her hands together. "After years of wallowing in dark tunnels, I, Constance von Nuvelle, will finally restore House Nuvelle to its former glory! With this one simple spell, everything will be set right! No longer will I shy from the sun's embrace! Tomorrow, I will welcome it with open arms and a smile on my face!"

Closing her eyes, Constance began to concentrate. Since the fall of House Nuvelle, she couldn't stand the Sun. Every time she felt its warmth wash over her, she was reminded of that day... The day House Nuvelle fell from grace. Anytime she was outside, she was reduced to a shell of her current self. But, finally, she had developed a solution to her dual personalities!

And now, there shall only be the Heir to House Nuvelle, the confident Constance von Nuvelle, genius spellcaster!

Eyes flying open, she pushed her hands out in front of her, her palms glowing a pale blue light. Pressing them together, the light formed into a small luminous ball, which she slowly pressed into her chest. A gentle warmth spread throughout her body, heating her slightly chilly body. It persisted for a few moments before dispersing, the chill of Abyss gradually resettling in her body.

"Well, I certainly don't feel any different," Constance commented, inspecting her hands. "But, I am sure that it... O-Oh... I-I..."

Stumbling as a sudden woosiness washed over her, Constance fell up against a nearby table, breathing heavily. She had experimented on herself numerous times in the past, with few ill effects. Never before had she felt so worn out, so exhausted, so... light-headed...

"Y-Yuri... Bal... Balthus... H...api..."

With a weak cry for her friends, Constance collapsed into unconsciousness...

=====


"...Found her like this. You think she was experimenting again?"

"Of course she was. It's all she does these days. She's a little obsessed, if you haven't noticed".

"I dunno. Pretty admirable, her trying to restore her house and all".

Groaning as familiar voices roused her from her unconsciousness, Constance cracked open an eye. She was still lying on the cold stone floor of the classroom, however something soft now supported her head.

"Hey, she's awake".

A brown skinned face, framed by messy red hair, appeared above her. It was joined by two more faces, one showing concern and the other amusement.

"About time, Princess," Yuri said, amusement morphing into a grin. "Gave us quite a fright, you lying on the floor like that. Any particular reason for it, or were you just that tired?"

Groaning as she sat up, she looked around at her gathered friends.

"My deepest apologies. Perhaps if I had checked my calculations more carefully, I would not have inconvenienced you all..."

The other three Wolves exchanged concerned looks.

"Why's she speaking like she's outside?" Balthus asked.

"Good question," Yuri answered, stroking his chin. "Let's see here... Hey, Princess, your dress is torn slightly".

Glancing down at her dress, which did indeed have a slight hole in its work fabric, Constance merely sighed.

"Oh, dear... I suppose it was damaged in my fall," She mumbled, a shadow falling across her face. "Please, do not gaze upon me and my naked flesh. I do not wish to embarrass you..."

The three exchanged another concerned look.

"Maybe a side effect of her magic?" Hapi suggested. "Like you said, she's always experimenting".

"Best explanation we've got," Yuri said, reaching a hand down to help Constance to her feet. As he pulled her up, she apologized multiple times for inconveniencing him. Ignoring her, he turned to the other two. "I'm going to take her to the surface, see if our usual haughty princess doesn't resurface. Take a look at her notes, try to figure out what she was doing here".

Hapi and Balthus nodded, turning to a nearby desk that had notes scattered across its surface. Yuri, still clutching Constance's hand, pulled her towards the exit to the Monastery. Along the way, her apologies persisted as she bumped into various people and objects.

Hopefully, she stops soon, Yuri thought, signing as he felt her clip his heel and apologize twice for it. It's getting on my nerves now...

=====


It took the duo a while, but they eventually reached the surface. As Yuri pulled Constance into the sunlight...
15533133312.title: Reversing the Effects of Light and Dark

choices: Upon entering the Dining Hall, Constance's personality shifts...
Constance is spotted by a Knight enroute...
Constance hears somebody calling her name...
155331333122.content:
Stepping out from the cool shade of Abyss' exit, Constance looked up towards the sky. Clear of any clouds, save for the barest whisp of one on the horizon, she could feel the sun's rays on her face, warming it nicely. Stroking her cheek with a finger, she continued to silently stare at the sky, a finger lightly tracing her cheek, until Yuri, concerned by her silence, finally spoke up.

"Well?" He prompted, stepping in front of Constance. "Feeling like restoring a fallen noble house? Or still depressed that it fell in the first place?"

Constance continued to stare at the sky for another couple of seconds, watching a couple of birds flit across it, before looking down at Yuri.

"Perhaps..." She started to say, prompting a grin to spread across Yuri's face. However, it quickly faded as she continued. "Perhaps it was best that House Nuvelle fell... The other families within the Empire didn't seem to mind..."

"And she's still depressed. Fantastic," Yuri sighed. "Come on, you. Let's hope Balthus and Hapi found something in your notes. While I'm not a fan of your other persona, it's slightly better than... whatever this is".

"My deepest apologies..." Constance apologised, bowing her head. "I will strive to be a better conversational partner in the future. However, I think it best if you pay little heed to me. I doubt I will be of much use to you..."

"In this state, yeah, you kinda are useless," Yuri stated bluntly. "But I'm not giving up on you, Princess. Let's head back down".

Yuri extended a hand out to her, however Constance didn't take it. Instead, she turned away from it, stepping away from the rough hole that was the entrance/exit to Abyss.

"Hey, hold on there!" Yuri called after her. "Lady Rhea and the Knights don't really like us wandering about up here! Not after that whole Chalice incident!"

Constance ignored him, continuing onwards until she was standing in front of the Student's Quarters. From what she knew, which, in her opinion, wasn't a great amount, the entrance to Abyss was situated next to that Professor's room. It was just outside their door she was stood, staring up at the sky yet again.

"The sun..." She mumbled to herself, reaching a pale hand up. "It... It warms me... Fills me with..."

She trailed off, basking in the pleasant afternoon warmth. By no means was she a fan of the sun or its warmth, associating both with the fall of her House, yet she was familiar enough with both to know that the heat of the sun didn't make your skin tingle, which it was currently doing to her. Reaching down to the recently formed tear in her dress, she gently poked her skin, recoiling with a slight gasp as the tingling intensified, if only for a brief moment.

"Perhaps it is the Goddess..." Constance mumbled to herself, poking her exposed skin again. "Punishing me for my failures..."

"What on Fodlan are you blathering about?" Yuri asked, appearing in front of her. "Whatever, it doesn't matter. Let's just go already".

Feeling a gloved hand rest on her shoulder, Constance allowed herself to be gently pulled back towards Abyss. Before she was pulled back into the shade, she shrugged Yuri's hand off. The tingling seemed to be getting stronger the longer she remained in the sunlight. Perhaps if she waited long enough, the Goddess would deem her worthy of a reward? Or, more likely, she would continue to be punished, for why would she deserve any sort of reward?

"Please forgive me, but I wish to remain in the light a little longer..." Constance told him. "Doubtless, this is an inconvenience to you, yet I must remain..."

"Oh, for..." Yuri took a deep breath, resting his head in the palm of his hand. "Fine, do as you want. Just don't come crying to me if the Knights take offense to you wandering around without an escort".

With a final sigh, Yuri disappeared back into the hole leading to Abyss, leaving Constance alone to stare up at the sky and wonder why she felt the way she did. With each passing second, her skin tingled more and more. It was getting to the point where, even without being physically touched, it was rather pleasurable for her.

"No, that cannot be true..." She mumbled apathetically. "I shouldn't be rewarded for my actions..."

Moving away from the hole leading to Abyss, Constance started towards the Greenhouse. As she walked, gaze kept low so she wouldn't offend anybody, she could feel people staring at her, muttering quietly amongst themselves.

"That's an odd uniform..."

"I don't think she actually attends the Officer's Academy..."

"Wait, wasn't she involved in that incident in the Chapel?"

Constance ignored the hushed voices of knights, students and common folk. She deserved to be talked about, for the Chapel incident was partially her fault. Her fault for being a part of House Nuvelle, for bearing the Crest of Noa, for trusting Aelfric so blindly...

"Perhaps it was best that House Nuvelle fell..." She mumbled again, pausing outside the Greenhouse. Inside, she could see a familiar amber-haired boy, the one who had helped them... Ashe, was it? He seemed to be tending to some sort of bright flower, a smile on his face as he did so. Unwilling to be seen by him, Constance turned away from the Greenhouse and made her way towards the Dining Hall, hoping that it was somewhat empty...

155332.content: Fire Emblem Warriors may not have the most new characters in a Fire Emblem Game, but that doesn't stop them from GROWING!
155332.title: For Aytolis!

info.brief_description: The F.E girls start to get top-heavy! Why? How? How BIG? You decide! G.P for additions!
info.description:
The Fire Emblem series is a series with a ton of awesome female characters! So what would happen if say...their breasts started growing? What would happen? How would they react? How would others react? This is a breast expansion interactive story detailing those events.

I'm giving 750 Gift Points to all story additions!

Here are the rules:

1. As if this wasn't obvious, only female characters are allowed to grow/expand; Multiple girls are able to grow at once.

2. While this is a Breast Expansion focused story, Butt Expansion and GTS are allowed.

3. The stories for the characters can be either comedic and silly or serious.

4. No OC's. Sorry.

5. For games with customizable avatars, such as Robin and Corrin from Awakening and Fates respectively, use their default design; Although you can incorporate both the Male and Female versions of them in the story. (Remember only the females can grow!)

6. For the sake of the story, please add a decent amount per chapter if you would like to post. If I notice a string of 1 or 2 sentence chapters, I will delete them for the sake of quality.

7. Please keep this story in English, and use decent grammar.

8. You can make the girls as big as you want, but please give detail and time for their growth. A.K.A, I do not want a character's breasts to go from normal to galaxy-sized in one chapter. (Basically no instant giga-size)

9. If you need to use a "Someone Else?" branch to create another story/path, please use the second choice to add another "Someone Else?" so more characters can eventually get stories.

10. Lewdness and 18+ stories / options are allowed!

11. Not really a rule, but be creative! As long as you follow these rules, you can do anything!


Thanks for reading, enjoy the story, and while you're at it, why not ADD to it? Additions are highly encouraged and appreciated!


Psst! Interested in Touhou and Breast Expansion? I have another interactive for that!
https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/2181829-Touhou-Project-Breast-Expa...

------------------

EDIT: Thanks for all of the support!
